content.description:
A unique sport climb that snakes its way up the overhanging SW face of the title boulder. Almost every hold is large, and almost none of the holds are down pulls. This route will test your core & upper arm power while leaving your fingertips mostly unharmed.

Stick clip the first bolt. Climb directly up the slabby dihedral & over a bulge to a huge mantel shelf where you can catch your breathe. A really fun v5ish boulder in & of itself. (there is an alternate easier start to the left, not recommended).

Climb easily up a couple body lengths of jugs, leading into much harder climbing above the 4th bolt. Battle through powerful climbing, with a heartbreaker crux right below the chains.
content.location: SW face of the title boulder

content.description:
This short steep climb has some of the wildest moves you're likely to ever find on a rope. A big wingspan is helpful on this one, but there is no substitute for the flexibility and technique needed to execute the boulder problem, side switching the arete.

Start as per "way of the wolf", go right above the 3rd bolt (back clean or skip bolt 3). Crux moves lead right past 2 fixed draws, then a final 3dimensional stem box over a bulge to good holds & the lower off chains above.

Clip back into the last fixed draw as you lower to clean the first 2 draws.
content.protection: 4 draws, 2 fixed draws, lower off chains
content.location: Same start as "way of the wolf"
